channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: How does India, with 1.3 billion people, have only 1,000 virus deaths?
item.description: Less than a month ago, India's future looked dire.

item.title: Dozens of virus cases linked to US primary voting
Pence tours clinic without a mask despite policy
item.description: Vice President Pence, who leads the White House's coronavirus task force, did not wear a mask while touring the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota despite being informed that wearing a mask is part of the clinic's policy.

item.title: China's model of control getting support during pandemic
Reporter's notebook: CNN's return to Wuhan after 76-day lockdown
item.description: CNN's David Culver returns to Wuhan, ground zero of the the novel coronavirus, three months after the Chinese city of 11 million people went into a 76-day lockdown. Here's what he found.

item.title: Trump still seems to not understand how bad the coronavirus crisis is
item.description: Three months in -- after a million infections, nearly 60,000 US deaths and a potential economic depression -- it's still unclear whether President Donald Trump grasps the gravity of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: New Zealanders are so eager to eat burgers after the coronavirus lockdown that police are having to enforce crowd control
item.description: Police in New Zealand have been required to enforce crowd control measures at a popular fast food outlet after large numbers of people rushed to buy burgers following a relaxing of the country's lockdown measures on Tuesday.

item.title: Sweden says its coronavirus approach has worked. The numbers suggest a different story
Swedish deputy PM: Covid-19 'is a marathon, not a sprint'
item.description: Sweden has been an outlier during the coronavirus outbreak, refraining from imposing strict limits on citizens' lives.

item.title: Trump to order meat processing plants to stay open, even as they become virus hot spots
Pence goes maskless at Mayo Clinic but was told of mask policy, deleted tweet said
item.description: â€¢ Trump to order meat processing plants to stay open, even as they become hot spots

item.title: Why this former US senator isn't surprised by the new UFO tapes
Stacey Abrams on VP potential: It's Joe Biden's choice
item.description: During an interview with CNN's Don Lemon, former Democratic Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams discusses the possibility of being 2020 presidential candidate Joe Biden's choice for vice president.

item.title: Giant asteroid will fly by Earth on Wednesday, close enough to see by telescope
item.description: An asteroid estimated to be 1.2 miles wide will fly by Earth early Wednesday morning, but it's not expected to collide with our planet.

item.title: In this country, more people have been killed by the police enforcing curfew than coronavirus
item.description: Perched on his apartment balcony in Nairobi, 13-year-old Yassin Hussein Moyo curiously watched police patrol the streets with his mother and siblings. A coronavirus related curfew had just started when a stray bullet struck him in the stomach.

item.title: Life inside an Israeli 'Coronavirus Hotel'
item.description: Comedian Noam Shuster documented her experience recovering from Covid-19 while living in a hotel full of strangers in Israel. See how they became her live audience.

item.title: Tara Reade's ex-neighbor says Reade told her about Biden sexual assault allegation in 1990s
Rare inflammatory syndrome seen in US child with Covid-19
item.description: US doctors say they may have seen a possible complication of coronavirus infection in a young child: a rare inflammatory condition called Kawasaki disease.

item.title: German doctors pose naked to protest protective equipment shortages
item.description: A website apparently featuring photos of German medical workers is calling attention to the working conditions and protective equipment needed by frontline workers amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Sweden and Georgia vs. everywhere else
item.description: The issue of states reopening versus states remaining closed is the top political question of the moment. Lives and livelihoods hang in the balance and we're starting to get some data.

item.title: Watch Blue Angels and Thunderbirds salute first responders
item.description: US Navy and Airforce jets flew over NYC, PA, and NJ in honor of first responders on the frontlines of Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: 'Martyr of hunger': Protester dies as desperate Lebanese take to streets
The Fox News/MSNBC mirror: Chris Hayes debunks video as Tucker Carlson hypes it
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: AMC bans Universal films from its theaters over 'Trolls World Tour' spat
item.description: AMC Theaters says it will no longer screen films made by Universal Pictures â€” a serious escalation of a dispute over the merits of releasing movies in theaters before allowing the public to watch them digitally.

item.title: Big commercial labs given priority for coronavirus testing equipment by feds
item.description: President Donald Trump said Monday that he is confident the US is conducting enough coronavirus testing to begin rebooting the economy, declaring at the White House press briefing that "testing is not going to be a problem at all."

item.title: California police investigating after viral video shows deputy punching teen
item.description: A police department and sheriff's office in Northern California are investigating a deputy's use of force after a viral video showed an officer punching a teen lying on the ground while attempting to detain him.

item.title: Stacey Abrams on sexual assault allegation against former VP: 'I believe Joe Biden'
item.description: Former Democratic Georgia gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams said Tuesday night that she believes the denial by former Vice President Joe Biden's campaign regarding onetime staffer Tara Reade's allegation that Biden sexually assaulted her in 1993.

item.title: China is installing surveillance cameras outside homes ... and sometimes even inside
item.description: The morning after Ian Lahiffe returned to Beijing, he found a surveillance camera being mounted on the wall outside his apartment door. Its lens was pointing right at him.

item.title: People with eating disorders have suffered all their lives. Now they're struggling even more
item.description: Cara Lisette has spent more than half her life battling anorexia. Now under the coronavirus lockdown, she says she is also fighting to find the few foods she considers "safe" to eat.

item.title: Coronavirus survivor leaves heartfelt message for caregivers
item.description: While a man was being treated in isolation for Covid-19, his caregivers at the Cleveland Clinic left him messages on his room's glass door. After his recent discharge, he left a heartfelt message for them.

item.title: Fox's firing of Diamond & Silk isn't the problem. Fox's hiring of them is.
item.description: After a series of false and misleading statements about how to combat the coronavirus, Fox News parted way with sisters Lynette "Diamond" Hardaway and Rochelle "Silk" Richardson this week, according to the Daily Beast.

item.title: Michigan man uses $900 savings to buy gas for nurses
item.description: Michigan resident Allen Marshall used $900 he'd been saving to buy gas for Detroit nurses during the coronavirus pandemic. Michigan is one of the hardest-hit states in the pandemic, according to Johns Hopkins University.

item.title: Reporter inadvertently reveals he was wearing no pants on air
item.description: Most of us have lost count of the days we've been in quarantine, working at home in pajamas and forgetting when we last went outdoors.

item.title: Bill Gates predicts when we'll get a coronavirus vaccine
item.description: Bill Gates, philanthropist and founder of Microsoft, discusses the timeline for a potential vaccine for Covid-19.

item.title: This city may become one large outdoor cafÃ©
item.description: Restaurants, cafÃ©s and bars in the Old Town of Vilnius, Lithuania, used to be fortunate to have a sidewalk table or two as part of their overall business operations.

item.title: Hong Kong airport provides a glimpse at the future of travel
item.description: Hong Kong International Airport has provided a glimpse into what post-coronavirus airport procedures might look like once we're traveling again, and a lot of disinfection technologies are involved.

item.title: Nurse sings to ailing hospice care patient
item.description: A nurse's tender moment helped lift the spirits of one Michigan family's ailing father.

item.title: Feng shui: Using ancient design principles in contemporary interiors
item.description: Hong Kong-based designer and feng shui consultant Thierry Chow's tips for incorporating elements of the ancient Chinese philosophy into your home.

item.title: A Dutch flower farm spelled out a special message for tourists missing the annual tulip blooms
item.description: Every year, tourists descend on the Netherlands to revel in the bright and colorful tulip fields. But with coronavirus putting many travel plans on hold, tourists have been notably absent this year.

item.title: Don Lemon is in stitches over Chris Cuomo's new haircut
item.description: CNN's Don Lemon pokes fun at Chris Cuomo's new haircut, which his wife gave to him while their family stays at home to abide by social distancing guidelines.

item.title: A dog that went missing after alerting her family to a tornado has been found 54 days later
item.description: A dog that saved her family's life by alerting them to a deadly tornado before it destroyed their Tennessee home has been found after nearly two months.

item.title: Which languages are easiest -- and most difficult -- for native English speakers to master?
item.description: With so much time on our hands during lockdown, many of us have entertained the idea of expanding our horizons.

item.title: Prince Harry introduces 'Thomas & Friends' special
item.description: The Duke of Sussex will introduce a special episode of "Thomas & Friends", celebrating the 75th anniversary of the children's animated show.

item.title: Mummies discovered in burial shaft in Egypt
item.description: Sarcophagi and wooden coffins containing human mummies are among the latest ancient finds to be uncovered by archeologists in Egypt. The finds were made in the Sacred Animal Necropolis in Saqqara, an ancient burial ground south of Cairo.

item.title: 'Jeopardy!' contestant breaks unwritten show rule
item.description: "Jeopardy!" contestant Sarah Jett Rayburn broke new ground on the game show by interrupting host Alex Trebek during a key part of the show.

item.title: Germany's coronavirus death toll surpasses 6,000
UK government taken by surprise at Scotland's move
item.description: The Scottish government has advised people to wear face coverings in enclosed public spaces, in a break from the UK-wide approach to tackling the spread of coronavirus.

item.title: Trump says 'experts got it wrong' when it comes to Covid-19
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta reports on President Donald Trump's early predictions of coronavirus cases and compares them to the most recent US case toll of 1 million infections.

item.title: The new rules of air travel
item.description: â€¢ Hong Kong airport provides glimpse of future

item.title: Pandemic messing with our concept of time
item.description: "What day is it, again?"
